intro: Anemone rockii var. pilocarpa, commonly known as the rock anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It features upright, branched stems that bear clusters of showy, white to pinkish flowers with a distinctive central tuft of stamens. The plant has palmately divided, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are hairy and grayish-green in appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. This species is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
